bitwarden.name: Bitwarden
use_cases: Best for people who want a standalone, dedicated password manager that syncs easily across devices with an established history
pros: Passkey support (web extension only to add new passkeys)

keepass.name: KeePassXC
use_cases: Best for people who distrust the cloud and want someting entirely local
pros: Passkey support (KeePassXC and KeePassDX, no recommended client for iOS at this time)
Multiple clients compatible with the vault's .kdbx format allows users to easily migrate to another similar app for any reason
cons: Other clients may not have the same features (audits, F-Droid availibility, passkey support)

protonpass.name: Proton Pass
use_cases: Best for people who prefer an all-in-one ecosystem (similar to Google Suite or Apple iCloud) because it includes cloud storage, calendar, mail, VPN, and more
pros: Available on all all operating systems (browser extension only for Linux and Mac)
Comes with free calendar, cloud storage, email, and VPN as part of a Proton account
cons: Browser extension required for desktop access (except for Windows)
Early product, missing some features that other password managers may already have
